Class HangmanController

java.lang.Object
HangmanController
public class HangmanController
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for handing all of the backend logic behind the GUI components. This class contains thirteen private member variables, most of which are GUI components. It also contains two methods, processGuess and restart.
Since:
11/06/21
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private javafx.scene.shape.Line body
    This private Line is the GUI component that will be displayed on the user's second incorrect guess.

    This private TextField is the GUI component that will display the number of lives that the user has remaining

    This HangmanModel object will store all of the information about the current game, including the total letters guessed, the incorrect letters guessed, the number of lives the user has remaining, and the word.

    private javafx.scene.control.TextField wordTextField
    This private TextField is the GUI component that will display the word (or partial word) that the user is trying to guess.

  • Field Details

    • model

      private HangmanModel model
      This HangmanModel object will store all of the information about the current game, including the total letters guessed, the incorrect letters guessed, the number of lives the user has remaining, and the word. It is also provides methods to access those variables, as well as indicate whether the game is over.

    • guessTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField guessTextField
      This private TextField is the GUI component that the user will use to enter their guesses.

    • livesLeftTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField livesLeftTextField
      This private TextField is the GUI component that will display the number of lives that the user has remaining

    • incorrectGuessesTextArea

      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea incorrectGuessesTextArea
      This private TextArea is the GUI component that will display all of the incorrect guesses that the user has made.

    • wordTextField

      private javafx.scene.control.TextField wordTextField
      This private TextField is the GUI component that will display the word (or partial word) that the user is trying to guess.

    • gameOverLabel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label gameOverLabel
      This private Label is the GUI component that will be displayed if the user has lost a game.

    • winnerLabel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label winnerLabel
      This private Label is the GUI component that will be displayed if the user has won a game.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • processGuess

      void processGuess​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is responsible for processing every guess that the user makes. Its jobs include reading in the guess, adding the guess to the totalGuesses (and possibly incorrectGuesses) ArrayList, adjusting the lives and hangman figure accordingly, and outputting the adjusted word and guesses to the screen.
      Parameters:
      event - This method takes an ActionEvent as a parameter. This ActionEvent is created whenever the user clicks on the 'Go' button.

    • restart

      void restart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is responsible for restarting the game. This method is called whenever the user clicks on the "Restart" button.
      Parameters:
      event - This method takes in an ActionEvent as a parameter. This action event is created whenever the user clicks on the "Restart" button.
